Created attachment 736738
Proposed fix

Description of problem:
Invocation of "npm help npm" should open up manpage of npm, but it fails due to manpage renames.

There are two options:
 * Fix the help code to deal with added "npm-" prefix and ".gz" suffix
 * Install compat symlinks into npm man directory itself

Since second options seemed like less maintenance burden I implemented it. Note that due to RPM bug 646523 there was a need for a hack to make it possible to update from older versions (symlink -> directory changes are not supported)

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
1.2.17-4
Applied, thanks!

Hmm, this is not ideal either since man in el6 will not detect compressed manpages *unless* they have .gz extension apparently. 

help.js code however checks for existence of manpage filename without the extension. Between rock and a hard place it seems. In the end we will probably have to modify help.js as well if we want to have a working solution. 

Making upstream fix so that distribution/expected manpages have .gz extension would help somewhat I believe. Manpages would go down from ~190K to 80K in size which is not huge difference overall but still useful IMO

For what it's worth I have a patch for upstream npm which would compress man pages. While we are at it, we could also rename them to npm-XXX. I believe it shouldn't matter to upstream that much since they care about "npm help XXX" command to work really, filenames are probably not that important

Heh, I started on a patch after I wrote that comment. :-)

Unfortunately, Solaris' `man` doesn't support gzipped man pages, so I don't think your patch will get merged.  :-(

My gut tells me this isn't going to get fixed nicely upstream, so I might as well carry a Fedora-specific patch that does away with all the symlink nonsense for good.  The help code rarely gets touched, so it shouldn't be much of a maintenance burden.

bugs.title: nodejs-boom needs upate on epel6 because of nodejs-hoek update

bugzilla.short_desc: nodejs-boom needs upate on epel6 because of nodejs-hoek update

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:

nodejs-boom-0.4.0-3.el6.noarch
  unresolved deps:

bugs.title: Anaconda - fatal error occurred installing npm package

bugzilla.short_desc: Anaconda - fatal error occurred installing npm package

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
I have written a custom RPM that requires nodejs, npm and python-simplejson. I have included my custom package, nodejs, npm, python-simplejson and all of their dependencies, along with the base and core package groups from centos6, in a custom distribution. When attempting to install this distribution, the first package Anaconda attempts to install is 'npm'.  It fails immediately with an error along the lines of "fatal error occurred installing npm package". 

Suspect this is occuring because the npm rpm does not provide a complete list of required packages (e.g. java?)

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
current version for el6

How reproducible:
always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Include npm in a custom distribution (I can provide a boot.iso image, if this would be useful).
2.
3.

Actual results:
System install fails with an error "Fatal error occurred installing npm package..."

Expected results:
Successful installation.


Additional info:

In order to figure out what's going on here, I'd need the logs from Anaconda, which are stored in /tmp/*.log during the installation.  (As you can imagine, "fatal error" isn't much to go on.  ;-)

You can access a terminal by pressing CTRL+ALT+F2 during the installation, if necessary.  For more information, see:
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Anaconda/Logging

Created attachment 768525
anaconda /tmp/ifcfg.log

Created attachment 768526
anaconda /tmp/program.log

Created attachment 768527
anaconda /tmp/storage.log

Created attachment 768528
anaconda /tmp/yum.log

Apologies. Perhaps these will shed some light. 

I didn't see anything to indicate why anaconda was failing on npm specifically, but I may be missing something.

Note that a custom distribution created using the exact same process but without npm installs without issue.

Oh I see what's going on now.  Sorry, I should have guessed this was what was going on.

> [2013-07-03 23:25:01,426] DEBUG   : TSINFO: Marking npm-1.2.17-5.el6.noarch as install for azure-cli-config-6-3.el6.noarch

This version of npm contained a hack that fixed a problem with `npm help` but unfortunately breaks installation of this package with anaconda (and only anaconda, yum installs still work fine).  npm-1.3.0 fixes this problem for real and restores the ability to install with anaconda.  It's currently in epel-testing [1].

Alternatively, if you can't use epel-testing on install, you could instead  use npm-1.2.17-4 [2], which doesn't have this hack (but `npm help` won't work).

Sorry for the trouble.

[1] https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2013-11693
[2] https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/buildinfo?buildID=411612

[depsolve] Error(s) resolving package dependencies: 
--> npm-1.3.0-1.el6.noarch requires npm(npmlog) = 0.0.3

bugs.title: npm: CVE-2013-4116 npm: Insecure temporary directory generation [epel-6]

bugzilla.short_desc: npm: CVE-2013-4116 npm: Insecure temporary directory generation [epel-6]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2013-4116 npm: Insecure temporary directory generation

long_desc.thetext:
An insecure temporary directory generation / use flaw was found in the way NPM, Node.js Package Manager, used to generate location of the temporary folder to be used for tarballs expansion. A local attacker could use this flaw to conduct symbolic link attacks, possibly leading to their ability to overwrite arbitrary system file reachable with the privileges of the user performing the NPM archive expansion.

References:
[1] http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/07/10/17
[2] http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/07/10/18
[3] http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/07/11/9

Upstream bug report:
[4] https://github.com/isaacs/npm/issues/3635

Relevant upstream patch:
[5] https://github.com/isaacs/npm/commit/f4d31693

This issue affects the versions of the npm package, as shipped with Fedora release of 18 and 19. Please schedule an update.

--

This issue affects the versions of the npm package, as shipped with Fedora EPEL-6. Please schedule an update.

Created npm tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 983918]
Affects: epel-6 [bug 983919]

This is now fixed in Fedora 18, 19, and EPEL 6 stable repositories.

Leaving this open since it still blocks a private bug.

(In reply to T.C. Hollingsworth from comment #5)
> This is now fixed in Fedora 18, 19, and EPEL 6 stable repositories.
> 
> Leaving this open since it still blocks a private bug.

Thank you, T.C. To leave this open was correct (the other npm package issue case shipped within Red Hat is in progress still). We will close this bug once the flaw has been corrected in all affected package versions.

Regards, Jan.
--
Jan iankko Lieskovsky / Red Hat Security Response Team
Private bug has status "CLOSED ERRATA". Therefore I am closing this bug. Please re-open if required.

notes:
This update provides the latest npm and updates its dependencies.  It also fixes a minor security bug.

For more information about recent changes in npm, see the changelog at GitHub:
https://github.com/isaacs/npm/commits/v1.3.3

Additionally, this update restricts all included packages to only the architectures supported by the V8 JavaScript runtime.
